item.title: Highguard is the New Secret Shooter from Creators of Titanfall and Apex, Coming January 26
item.content:encoded:
While The Game Awards always has plenty of its trademark “World Premieres,” usually only a few of them are legitimate surprises. Leaks, or just common sense, often spill the beans ahead of time. Well, this year the big show ended with a completely under-the-radar announcement – Highguard. This new PvP raid shooter is coming our way from a number of the original creators of Titanfall and Apex Legends who broke away from Respawn Entertainment to form the new studio Wildlight Entertainment.

Highguard looks like it’s going to be pushing a lot of different ideas at once, with tons of different powers in the mix, although the thing people are probably most likely to pick up on is that you can shoot people while riding a dang horse. A horseback shooter – it’s one of those things you never knew you needed until you see it with your own eyes. Check out the debut trailer for Highguard for yourself, below.

Is Highguard primed to be the next breakout indie-developed shooter ala something like Arc Raiders? That's a tough call to make, but it certainly has the pedigree behind it and looks to be throwing a lot at the wall. You can't say this one is playing it safe, that's for sure. The game’s Steam page is up, with this rather basic description of the game attached…

“From the creators of Apex Legends and Titanfall, comes Highguard: a PvP raid shooter where players will ride, fight, and raid as Wardens, arcane gunslingers sent to fight for control of a mythical continent. Battle rival Warden crews for possession of the Shieldbreaker, then break into and destroy the enemy base to secure territory in this all-new breed of shooter.”

Highguard is coming to PC, Xbox Series X/S, and PS5. We won’t have to wait too long to find out exactly what kind of game it is and what level of potential it has, as it will be launching on January 26, 2026. The game will be free to play.

Follow Wccftech on Google to get more of our news coverage in your feeds.



https://wccftech.com/highguard-the-game-awards-announced-titanfall-apex-legends/

item.title: Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 Dominates The Game Awards 2025, Full Winners List
item.content:encoded:
The Game Awards 2025 have come and gone, and the heavyweight favourite, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33, did not disappoint. It went home with the most wins of the night, including some of the bigger awards like Best Art Direction, Best Score and Music, Best Narrative, Best Game Direction, and of course, Game of the Year.

Because Clair Obscur came into the show with 12 nominations (10 if you only count one of its three Best Performance nominations), and it won most of its categories, there weren't really other standout games. It was Clair Obscur's night, through and through, as it nearly swept The Game Awards, winning 9 out of 10 possible awards.

Battlefield 6 was the only game to beat Clair Obscur, taking home Best Audio Design and keeping Sandfall Interactive from the full sweep. That said, it technically also lost to Wuthering Waves in the Player's Voice category, so make that 9 of 11 possible wins.

Hollow Knight Silksong was able to walk away with one win, and South of Midnight picked up a win as well. ARC Raiders also took home the award for Best Multiplayer game, and No Man's Sky grabbed Best Ongoing game. And while the more exciting part of the night for Larian Studios was its reveal of Divinity, it also took home Best Community Support for Baldur's Gate 3.

Here's the full list of winners from tonight's The Game Awards 2025.

The Game Awards 2025 Winners Full List

Best Performance

  • Ben Starr - Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
  • Charlie Cox - Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
  • Erika Ishii - Ghost of Yotei
  • Jennifer English - Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 - Winner
  • Konatsu Kato - Silent Hill f
  • Troy Baker - Indiana Jones and the Great Circle

Best Ongoing Game

  • Final Fantasy XIV: Dawntrail
  • Fortnite
  • Helldivers 2
  • Marvel Rivals
  • No Man's Sky - Winner

Best Mobile Game

item.title: Total War: Warhammer 40,000 Announced, Will be an Epic Multi-Planet Clash
item.content:encoded:
The Total War series has gone a lot of places over the years, from every corner of real-world history you could imagine, to the fantasy realms of Warhammer, but now the folks at Creative Assembly are kicking it up a notch and bringing the battle to the grimdark future. Yes, that’s right, at The Game Awards 2025, Creative Assembly officially revealed Total War: Warhammer 40,000 (with some help from Stranger Things’ David Harbour).

The trailer included first gameplay footage, which looks suitably intense, and the scope looks impressive, with the camera zooming out at the end of the trailer to show that the battle will be unfolding over multiple planets. You can check out the trailer for yourself, below.

Total War: Warhammer 40K’s Steam page is up now, revealing the game’s four factions:

“Space Marines: Genetically enhanced weapons of war, these warriors are few in number but near unmatched in power. Clad in sacred armour and wielding the Imperium’s most deadly weaponry, each strikes with devastating and unyielding precision.

Orks: Brutish hordes of destruction, they are unrelenting, countless and live for war. Storming the battlefield in endless mobs, they brandish unpredictable weapons and clanking war machines - all driven by the primal power of the WAAAGH!

Aeldari: An ancient and waning xenos race, who once ruled the stars, but now rail against their certain fate. Swift and elusive, they strike with psychic precision and elegant weaponry, exploiting weakness before vanishing into shadow.

Astra Militarum: The massed ranks of humanity’s largest fighting force are a bulwark of flesh and steel. Their legions of soldiers' march beneath the roar of battle-tanks and the thunder of artillery, grinding enemies into ruin with disciplined fury and sheer determination.”

Total War: Warhammer 40,000 has been announced for PC. A release window has not yet been revealed, which means we'll likely be waiting for a while.

Follow Wccftech on Google to get more of our news coverage in your feeds.



https://wccftech.com/total-war-warhammer-40000-announced-the-game-awards/

item.title: Diablo IV: Lord of Hatred Revealed at TGA 2025, Arrives on PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X/S in April 2026
item.content:encoded:
Blizzard was one of the studios that took over the The Game Awards 2025 stage tonight with its announcement, which was the reveal for Diablo IV's next major expansion, Lord of Hatred, which is due to arrive on PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X/S this coming April 28, 2026.

Lord of Hatred follows the game's last major expansion, Vessel of Hatred, and is "the climax of the Age of Hatred," according to a press release. Players must fight back the forces of Mephisto as they now have the run of the Sanctuary, and players will be pulled towards an ally they can't trust, but will have to work with.

The expansion adds two new classes, a Paladin class and a second class that has yet to be revealed. It also adds a new region of Skovos, a reworked skill tree, a new loot filter, enhanced crafting, a new powerful talisman, and player-driven war plans.

When Blizzard announced its roadmap for 2025 this past April, this expansion arriving in 2026 was one of the final updates the studio had already set in stone, including a new ranking system, leaderboards, and more that Blizzard wasn't ready to share at the time. Hopefully, we'll hear more about its 2026 plans soon.

Wccftech's Alessio Palumbo reviewed Vessel of Hatred when it arrived in October 2024, at the time writing, "Diablo IV Vessel of Hatred is a solid expansion that is perhaps not heavy on content but more than makes up for it with many systemic changes that will elevate the whole game for years to come."

For all of our coverage of The Game Awards 2025, check out our hub page here.

Follow Wccftech on Google to get more of our news coverage in your feeds.



https://wccftech.com/diablo-iv-lord-of-hatred-expansion-release-date/
